comments.body: nit: not a fan of named returns.
Just following the style in the functions below. Am not a fan either.
It's not a server resource?  It's just a local object.  Version mapper shouldn't be blocking this - the server should never have to know about Lists
Yea, I felt really wrong typing this in, but without it, `kubectl create -f hack/testdata/list.yaml` fails. I am certainly open to other suggestions.
You probably want this to be an ordered list so that someone providing discovery information can provide a preferred order: "I prefer vX, but if you don't have it, try vA, vB, vD`
The preferred versions are in the `Group` field.
